data.value: Collaboration
Slide to the left or right to select a sentence describing your most likely behaviour.
Invovle Colleagues to make decisions that affect them or the scope of their job
I make plans and decisions affecting others without reaching out to them or miss the opportunity to leverage others’ expertise when needed or contact the wrong stakeholders.
I involve in meetings only colleagues impacted by my decisions. I consult them to build a complete picture of the situation. I integrate my perspective and move forward.
I clarify with colleagues how the decision making will be managed and redirect effort if their contribution is not needed.
I do not know.
Place collective success over the individual one
I place my own interest above the collective success, resulting in a poor collaboration atmosphere and/or not dealing with conflicts.
I work for collective success even when it goes against individual interest and constructively deal with conflicts.
I formalise what collective success looks like and involve everyone to work toward this objective, despite conflicts.
I do not know.
Set the “Rules of the game” and “Ways of working” to effectively collaborate
I miss opportunities to clarify ways of working and/or start tasks/projects and clarify rules too late in the process and/or use emails/messages to 'cover my back' or blame others for mistakes.
Before starting to work on a task/project, I clarify the target and way to collaborate. When conflicts arise, I focus on solutions and identify how to move forward.
I set clear informal governance (examples: ways of working, rules of the game, meeting focus: operational, governance, future topics, …) to set the basis of a strong and sustainable collaboration.
I do not know
Ask for, deliver and receive constructive feedback
I miss opportunities to ask for feedback and/or do not confront others openly and/or am not receptive to others' suggestions.
I ask for, deliver and accept other's feedback resulting in an improvement of the collaboration.

I actively seek others' feedback and leverage others' input as a learning opportunity. I avoid any triangulation in feedback. (example: A speaks to C to give feedback to B. A must give the feedback directly to B).
I do not know.
Value diversity as an opportunity to enrich collaboration

I miss opportunities to value diversity and/or get closer only with people with similar perspective/personality/values and/or might fall into judgement and stereotyping, i.e. in discriminative attitudes.
I respect others’ points of view in their differences, i.e. do not discriminate against others. I integrate others’ perspectives underscoring their value towards developing solutions.

I fully understand the difference between discrimination and diversity. I model a ‘zero discrimination’ attitude (verbalising it) while leveraging the value of diversity of personality, points of view and building constructive and sustainable relationships.
I do not know.
